results.title: Ultra shorts: 1994 V.C.A. compilation
results.creator_credit: Tony D'Aquino, Daniel Crooks, Guy Richards, Sima Urale, Emma Kelly, Jolyon Watkins, Beckett Broda and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Selection of seven short films by students from the Victorian College of the Arts. “The Baron”: A Young man recalls his friendship with an eccentric misfit who thinks he is the Red Baron. “Toll”: Tense, surreal drama inspired by the horror of the road toll. “Ultra vires”: An animated film about the mythical struggle between a girl and a dragon. “Burning moths”: A girl in white visits the share house from hell. “Trumpet”: Poignant story of a boy’s effort to win his father’s approval. “Food (for) thought: (three) ingredients from the mass consumer diet”: An animated film about bread, religion and television. “Lost and vicious”: Noir nasties fight it out on the highway at night.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony D’Aquino, Daniel Crooks, Guy Richards, Sima Urale, Emma Kelly, Jolyon Watkins, Beckett Broda and Victorian College of the Arts

results.title: Ulster heritage
results.creator_credit: Stanley Willis, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: From the story of one family and one farm in Northern Ireland, a colorful and impressive picture of a modern farming community emerges, giving incidental glimpses of Ulster as a highly modern industrialised province and a place of considerable scenic attractions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Willis, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions

results.title: Ulster
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scenic and sporting attractions of Northern Ireland and records, in particular, sequences from recent Tourist Trophy motor and Grand Prix motor-cycle events (featuring Stirling Moss). The film includes a visit to Belfast, capital of Northern Ireland; scenic attractions among the mountain and lake country; a visit to Carlingford Lough and the Silent Valley; a drive through the Glen of Antrim to Portrush, famous for its swimming, sailing and its golf course.

results.title: Ulee's gold
results.creator_credit: Victor Nunez, Clinica Estetico and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This touching film presents a subtle study of the difficulties and complexities involved in the development and maintenance of lasting human relations. It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.

results.title: Ulcer at work
results.creator_credit: Ned Hockman and University of Oklahoma
results.brief_description: Looks at the way in which emotional problems can cause ulcers, and illustrates the prescribed mental attitudes and dietary procedures necessary for curing a peptic ulcer in its preliminary stage.

results.title: Ukrainian dance
results.creator_credit: Laura Boulton and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Music and dances are performed by the Ukrainian Canadians of Manitoba, largest Slavonic group in Canada. The first part of the film shows the customs and religious ceremonies at holidays for these people. Four dances comprise the second part of the film: the Bird Dance, the Cossack Dance, the Cossack War Dance, and the Catherina Dance.

results.title: UK Prime Minister in Africa
results.brief_description: Scenes from Mr Harold MacMillan’s tour of Africa in the spring of 1960. Accompanied by Lady Dorothy MacMillan, the Prime Minister visits Ghana, Nigeria and the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland, witnessing both the spectacular material progress in these quickly developing territories and the friendliness and goodwill which have not been affected by the achievement of the prospect of independence.

results.title: Ugly, dirty and bad = Brutti, sporchi e cattivi
results.creator_credit: Ettore Scola, Carlo Ponti and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion
results.brief_description: Director Ettore Scola focuses on a large dysfunctional family living in a shanty town on the outskirts of Rome. The stingy patriarch, Giacinto, is personally wealthy but morally bankrupt, and his repulsive view of life trickles down to every member of his clan. Not content with corrupting his own flesh and blood, Giacinto spreads his philosophy throughout the entire village, where he functions as slumlord. Although the surroundings and characters exist at the lowest level of society, their misery is very funny at times, imbued with enormous energy in a daily fight to maintain their survival. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Nino Manfredi, Maria Bosco and Giselda Castrini.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari = Tales of the pale and silvery moon after the rain
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: An unforgettably haunting film in every sense, this film is adapted from two stories in a collection of ghostly tales by the eighteenth-century writer Akinari Ueda, and Guy De Maupassant. Genjuro, a poor potter trying to make a living in a war-torn medieval village, is lured away from his devoted wife and young son by the mysterious Lady Wasaka who turns out to be a ghost. When Genjuro returns home repentant, his wife, too, has become a ghost after being murdered by stragglers weary from battle. Mizoguchi’s depiction of the past is vivid, richly detailed but not in the least romantic. For all its panache, the age he shows us is one of cruelty, oppression, and often appalling casual brutality. Cast includes Masayuki Mori, Kinuyo Tanaka and Machiko Kyo. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari [Extract]
results.creator_credit: Contemporary Films and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: An extract from what is considered to be a masterpiece of Japanese director, Kenji Mizoguchi. Set in sixteenth century Japan, its theme is that of the humble commoner who aspires to wealth and glory only to find them, when achieved, a delusion leading to agony and shame. In Japanese with English subtitles. Suitable for upper secondary level.
